formalText: They have had ECT treatment and the patient thinks it worked.
The SSRI treatment is what they just started they are on that over adderal.
They want to say it was helpful soon after the treatment itself.
They keep thinking things will get better things but things are still bad.
They think a lot about killing themself and they are sure they have the courage to do it.
They will be feeling better but then they go home and the depression falls onto them like a ton of bricks.
It obliterates their recollection of things ever being better, their optimism.
They are afraid they kill themself.
They were scared of their therapist, from childhood, finding out that they were depressed. They were sort of desperate to protect themself.
The therapist clearly wasn't going to help them and they did not want their mom or dad knowing about their depression.
